alert.note: Alert for Graham; Macon; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 25 at 3:44AM EDT until March 25 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Macon County in western North Carolina... Central Swain County in western North Carolina... Graham County in western North Carolina... * Until 445 AM EDT. * At 343 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles east of Madisonville to 5 miles southwest of Ducktown, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Robbinsville, Town Of Santeetlah, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Lake Santeetlah, Fontana Lake, Nantahala Lake, Fontana Village, Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek, Smoky Mountains-Clingmans Dome and Wesser. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
